title: How to Restore Deleted Files on a SD Card

steps.title: Navigate to the PhotoRec Wiki or click | here.
steps.content: Navigate to the PhotoRec Wiki or click | here .

steps.title: Locate the “Latest Stable Version” box and click “7.0”.
steps.content: Locate the “Latest Stable Version” box and click “7.0”. This box is located in the upper right-hand corner of the page. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down to “TestDisk & PhotoRec 7.0” and click on the version compatible with your computer.
steps.content: Scroll down to “TestDisk & PhotoRec 7.0” and click on the version compatible with your computer. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Download the zip file to your desktop.
steps.content: Download the zip file to your desktop.

steps.title: Double click on the file to unzip it.
steps.content: Double click on the file to unzip it. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Insert your SD card into your computer.
steps.content: Insert your SD card into your computer.

steps.title: Click on the “testdisk7.0” file to open it.
steps.content: Click on the “testdisk7.0” file to open it.

steps.title: Double-click on the “Photorec” file to open the program.
steps.content: Double-click on the “Photorec” file to open the program. A terminal window will open up with the PhotoRec 7.0 program. If prompted, grant permission to run the program. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Select your SD Card, or drive, and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Select your SD Card, or drive, and press ↵ Enter . Since your mouse will not work in terminal, you must use your keyboard’s up and down arrow keys. You may be presented with multiple options on this screen. Note the size of each drive listed and choose the drive that is the same size as your SD card. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Select the partition type and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Select the partition type and press ↵ Enter . Mac users choose “P Fat16 >32”. Windows users pick “P Fat32”. This will allow the program to scan the camera’s established directory system. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Select the filesystem type “[Other]” and then press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Select the filesystem type “[Other]” and then press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Select “Free” to search for files in Fat16 or Fat32.
steps.content: Select “Free” to search for files in Fat16 or Fat32. Only choose “Whole” if you believe your SD card is corrupted.

steps.title: Use the arrow keys to choose a location to store the recovered files.
steps.content: Use the arrow keys to choose a location to store the recovered files. You may create a folder at this time for the recovered files. Do not save the files to the SD card.

steps.title: Press C once the location is correct.
steps.content: Press C once the location is correct. The recovery process will start automatically.

steps.title: Wait for the recovery process to finish.
steps.content: Wait for the recovery process to finish.

steps.title: Navigate to the location you selected in step 13 to view your recovered files.
steps.content: Navigate to the location you selected in step 13 to view your recovered files. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to Recuva’s homepage or click | here.
steps.content: Navigate to Recuva’s homepage or click | here .

steps.title: Select “Download Free Version” followed by “Free Download”.
steps.content: Select “Download Free Version” followed by “Free Download”. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Click “FreeHippo.com” or “Piriform.com”.
steps.content: Click “FreeHippo.com” or “Piriform.com”. You will be taken to either website and the download will start automatically. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Click on the downloaded file at the base of the webpage to open it.
steps.content: Click on the downloaded file at the base of the webpage to open it. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Select “Run”.
steps.content: Select “Run”.

steps.title: Install Recuva.
steps.content: Install Recuva. To install this software on your computer, follow these steps: Click “Ok”. Click “Next”. Read through the License Agreement and select “I Agree”. Click “Install”. Uncheck the box next to “View Release notes” and then click “Finish. The program will launch automatically.

steps.title: Insert the SD card into your computer.
steps.content: Insert the SD card into your computer. If prompted to format the SD card, check the box next to “Quick Format” and then click “Start”. This will erase the SD card’s table of contents and leave the data untouched. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Return to the Recuva program and click “Next” to proceed from the Welcome screen.
steps.content: Return to the Recuva program and click “Next” to proceed from the Welcome screen. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Select the type of file(s) you would like the program to recover then click “Next”.
steps.content: Select the type of file(s) you would like the program to recover then click “Next”.

steps.title: Select your SD Card as the file location.
steps.content: Select your SD Card as the file location. Choose “In a specific location” and then click “Browse”. Scroll through the list and select “Removable Disk”. Select the “DCIM” folder if needed. Click “Ok” followed by “Next”.

steps.title: Click “Start” to run the program.
steps.content: Click “Start” to run the program. As the program recovers files, they will appear on the screen.

steps.title: Check the box beneath each file you would like to recover.
steps.content: Check the box beneath each file you would like to recover.

steps.title: Click “Recover”.
steps.content: Click “Recover”.

steps.title: Select a location to save the files and then click “Ok”.
steps.content: Select a location to save the files and then click “Ok”. The files will be restored to the location you selected.

steps.title: Click “Ok” once the restoration process is complete.
steps.content: Click “Ok” once the restoration process is complete.

steps.title: Navigate to the location you selected in step 14 to view your recovered files.
steps.content: Navigate to the location you selected in step 14 to view your recovered files. [13] X Research source
